front.title: The Authentication Suboption for the DHCP Relay Agent Option

abstract.t: The DHCP Relay Agent Information Option (RFC 3046) conveysinformation between a DHCP relay agent and a DHCP server. Thisspecification defines two mechanisms for securing the messagesexchanged between a relay agent and a server. The first mechanismdefines a new authentication suboption for the Relay AgentInformation Option that supports source entity authentication anddata integrity for relayed DHCP messages. The authenticationsuboption contains a cryptographic signature in a payload derivedfrom the option used in DHCP Authentication (RFC 3118). The secondmechanism uses IPsec (RFC 2041) to protect messages exchanged betweenrelay agents and servers.
